pullRequest.body:
- [x] Add the theorem `top_add_of_ne_bot` which states that for any extended real number `x` which is not `⊥`, the sum of `⊤` and `x` is equal to `⊤`.
- [x] Add the theorem `add_top_of_ne_bot` which states that for any extended real number `x` which is not `⊥`, the sum of `x` and `⊤` is equal to `⊤`.
- [x]  Add the theorem `add_pos` which states that for any two extended real numbers `a` and `b`, if both `a` and `b` are greater than `0`, then their sum is also greater than `0`.
- [x] Add the theorem `mul_pos` which states that the product of two positive extended real numbers is positive. 
- [x] Add the theorem `add_top_iff_ne_bot` which states that for any extended real number `x`, the sum of `x` and `⊤` is equal to `⊤` if and only if `x` is not `⊥`.
- [x] Add the theorem `top_add_iff_ne_bot` which states that for any extended real number `x`, the sum of `⊤` and `x` is equal to `⊤` if and only if `x` is not `⊥`.
 
Co-authored-by: @D-Thomine 

-- 

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:

```
</details>

</details>

Thank you @fpvandoorn. I have converted into a draft because I want to add other related theorems in this file.

I will reopen it soon.

Ok @fpvandoorn, I have completed the following tasks: 

- [x] Add the theorem `top_add_of_ne_bot` which states that for any extended real number `x` which is not `⊥`, the sum of `⊤` and `x` is equal to `⊤`.
- [x] Add the theorem `add_top_of_ne_bot` which states that for any extended real number `x` which is not `⊥`, the sum of `x` and `⊤` is equal to `⊤`.
- [x]  Add the theorem `add_pos` which states that for any two extended real numbers `a` and `b`, if both `a` and `b` are greater than `0`, then their sum is also greater than `0`.
- [x] Add the theorem `mul_pos` which states that the product of two positive extended real numbers is positive. 
- [x] Add the theorem `add_top_iff_ne_bot` which states that for any extended real number `x`, the sum of `x` and `⊤` is equal to `⊤` if and only if `x` is not `⊥`.
- [x] Add the theorem `top_add_iff_ne_bot` which states that for any extended real number `x`, the sum of `⊤` and `x` is equal to `⊤` if and only if `x` is not `⊥`.

I should have addressed all the review comments. 

Thank you @fpvandoorn and @j-loreaux for your reviews.

bors d+
Please merge after CI finished and succeeded.

:v: pitmonticone can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9663228868/job/26654889094)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9663228868/job/26654888719)
only style nits

LGTM, thanks

It might also be useful to add `iff` versions of these two lemmas (keep the current lemmas as well if you think they're useful simp lemmas).
only style nits

```suggestion
theorem top_add_of_ne_bot {x : EReal} (h : x ≠ ⊥) : ⊤ + x = ⊤ := by
```
and the other one `add_top_of_ne_bot`. 
Hypotheses should come after `_of_`, and not be "inlined".
Done. Thanks!

style nit
```suggestion
/-- For any extended real number `x` which is not `⊥`, the sum of `⊤` and `x` is equal to `⊤`. -/
```

style nit. Also, you can leave these docstrings in, but I don't think they're adding anything meaningful. Maybe in the future consider whether reading the docstring is actually simpler than reading the statement. :shrug:
```suggestion
/-- For any extended real number `x`, the sum of `⊤` and `x` is equal to `⊤`
if and only if `x` is not `⊥`. -/
```
Yes, you're totally right. Sorry for the pedantry.

```suggestion
/-- For any extended real number `x` which is not `⊥`, the sum of `x` and `⊤` is equal to `⊤`. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- For any extended real number `x`, the sum of `x` and `⊤` is equal to `⊤`
if and only if `x` is not `⊥`. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- For any two extended real numbers `a` and `b`, if both `a` and `b` are greater than `0`,
then their sum is also greater than `0`. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- The product of two positive extended real numbers is positive. -/
```
`rw [add_comm, top_add_of_ne_bot]`
Done, thanks!

```suggestion
```
This doesn't feel like a `simp` lemma. Note that `simp` only uses theorems with side-conditions if those side-conditions can be proven by the discharger, which is `simp` by default. The above equalities with the `x ≠ ⊥` conditions are already on the edge of what is useful to `simp`, because it will only rewrite if it can actually find a proof for the side-condition. (But I think those are fine)
Done, thanks!

```suggestion
  · rw [top_add_of_ne_bot (bot_lt_zero.trans hb).ne']
```
(didn't test, also line above)
Done, thanks!

```suggestion
```
Oh sorry. I changed it yesterday, but I didn't pushed it 🤦‍♂️.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Data/Real/EReal): add simp theorems involving the sum of `⊤` and `x`
